DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numerical value that represents the assessment of breathing effort by a neonate, as a component of the APGAR test.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A test devised by Dr. Virginia Apgar to assess the overall health of a newborn upon birth. The test is administered at one and five minutes after birth and allows for the assignation of numerical values between zero and two for specific observations regarding skin color, pulse rate, reflex irritability, muscle tone and breathing._A component of the APGAR score, it is the numerical value assigned to the assessment of breathing effort by a neonate. 0 = no spontaneous respirations; 1 = slow or irregular respirations or a weak cry; 2 = strong, consistent respirations with a robust cry.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A test devised by Dr. Virginia Apgar to assess the overall health of a newborn upon birth. The test is administered at one and five minutes after birth and allows for the assignation of numerical values between zero and two for specific observations regarding skin color, pulse rate, reflex irritability, muscle tone and breathing.

The test is administered at one and five minutes after birth and allows for the assignation of numerical values between zero and two for specific observations regarding skin color, pulse rate, reflex irritability, muscle tone and breathing.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A component of the APGAR score, it is the numerical value assigned to the assessment of breathing effort by a neonate. 0 = no spontaneous respirations; 1 = slow or irregular respirations or a weak cry; 2 = strong, consistent respirations with a robust cry._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Strong Consistent Respirations With a Robust Cry

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Strong Consistent Respirations With a Robust Cry
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having strength, power, or intensity greater than average or expected.: Marked by a reasonable or logical relation of parts and holding together as a harmonious or credible whole.: Distinct from cell or tissue respiration, Respiration is the act of breathing with the lungs and consists of inspiration, or taking ambient air into the lungs, and expiration, or expelling modified air that contains more carbon dioxide than the air taken in. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: Having strength, power, or intensity greater than average or expected.
Marked by a reasonable or logical relation of parts and holding together as a harmonious or credible whole.

Distinct from cell or tissue respiration, Respiration is the act of breathing with the lungs and consists of inspiration, or taking ambient air into the lungs, and expiration, or expelling modified air that contains more carbon dioxide than the air taken in. (NCI)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Proceeding at a low speed; taking a comparatively long time.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Lacking perfect symmetry or evenness.: Distinct from cell or tissue respiration, Respiration is the act of breathing with the lungs and consists of inspiration, or taking ambient air into the lungs, and expiration, or expelling modified air that contains more carbon dioxide than the air taken in. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: Proceeding at a low speed; taking a comparatively long time.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

Distinct from cell or tissue respiration, Respiration is the act of breathing with the lungs and consists of inspiration, or taking ambient air into the lungs, and expiration, or expelling modified air that contains more carbon dioxide than the air taken in. (NCI)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.: Happening or arising without apparent external cause.: Distinct from cell or tissue respiration, Respiration is the act of breathing with the lungs and consists of inspiration, or taking ambient air into the lungs, and expiration, or expelling modified air that contains more carbon dioxide than the air taken in. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.
Happening or arising without apparent external cause.

Distinct from cell or tissue respiration, Respiration is the act of breathing with the lungs and consists of inspiration, or taking ambient air into the lungs, and expiration, or expelling modified air that contains more carbon dioxide than the air taken in. (NCI)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
